channel.title: Playerauctions?
channel.description:
I'm a bit confused :/. I'm trying to sell my account on it and there customer service is crap. I've had a lot of experiance with there customer service(when there actually online) like randomly get my account suspended, unsuspended etc, them being waaay late on payments so trust me I cannot bear using them again :L(I used to buy to sell through other methods agees ago). So I want to sell my account on there but I'm a bit confused, I think its a generalised game account layout thingy could someone explain what I'm to do? What it says[code]Please upload one screenshot of your game account management screen (which includes Name of the Account, Owner's Full name and Address, etc), and one currently valid photo I.D.
Please note, that if you submit photos of the account information page, and also a copy of your valid I.D., PlayerAuctions will deduct an additional fixed fee for verifying your account and listing it as a Prime Verified account for sale offer. See below for details: For accounts with a value less than $50 the Verified account fee will be $1 For accounts with a value greater than $50 but less than $100, the Verified account fee will be $2 For all accounts with values greater than $100, the Verified account fee will equal 2% of the total account value, with a minimum fee of $5. If you do not upload copies of the account management information page and a copy of a currently valid photo I.D., or if your submissions are rejected, then the difference from any discounted insurance options which the buyer purchases will be deducted from your overall disbursement. [/code] [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/692x7d.jpg[/img] Also, I don't have any valid ID apart from my birth certificate.. would that suffice?

item.title: Playerauctions?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Pishtako:

use your dad’s ID or something.

My dads an alcholic druggy that I never see O_o. I’d prefer using my own though since I am of legal age to sell things + my mum doesn’t let me sell things on her account due to her knowing I’ve been charged back over a total of $1k usd. I don’t really understand what its asking me though. Okay, ID = can I use birth certificate.
This page on rs for details, I’ve never heard of it…

Read full topic

item.title: Playerauctions?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I’m a bit confused :/. I’m trying to sell my account on it and there customer service is crap. I’ve had a lot of experiance with there customer service(when there actually online) like randomly get my account suspended, unsuspended etc, them being waaay late on payments so trust me I cannot bear using them again :L(I used to buy to sell through other methods agees ago).
So I want to sell my account on there but I’m a bit confused, I think its a generalised game account layout thingy could someone explain what I’m to do?
What it says[code]Please upload one screenshot of your game account management screen (which includes Name of the Account, Owner’s Full name and Address, etc), and one currently valid photo I.D.

Please note, that if you submit photos of the account information page, and also a copy of your valid I.D., PlayerAuctions will deduct an additional fixed fee for verifying your account and listing it as a Prime Verified account for sale offer. See below for details:
For accounts with a value less than $50 the Verified account fee will be $1
For accounts with a value greater than $50 but less than $100, the Verified account fee will be $2
For all accounts with values greater than $100, the Verified account fee will equal 2% of the total account value, with a minimum fee of $5.
If you do not upload copies of the account management information page and a copy of a currently valid photo I.D., or if your submissions are rejected, then the difference from any discounted insurance options which the buyer purchases will be deducted from your overall disbursement.
[/code]

692x7d.jpg1024×728

Also, I don’t have any valid ID apart from my birth certificate… would that suffice?

Read full topic
